Specific Details: Pfizer is seeking reimbursement for a new treatment for metastatic breast cancer. Metastatic breast cancer is an advanced form of breast cancer where early detection unfortunately does not improve survival. Even if diagnosed with early stage breast cancer, 30% of women will subsequently progress to metastatic disease. While there have been advances in breast cancer therapy, metastatic breast cancer currently remains incurable and a need exists for new and better treatments.
Subject Matter: Pfizer is seeking reimbursement for a new treatment for metastatic breast cancer. Metastatic breast cancer is an advanced form of breast cancer where early detection unfortunately does not improve survival. Even if diagnosed with early stage breast cancer, 30% of women will subsequently progress to metastatic disease. While there have been advances in breast cancer therapy, metastatic breast cancer currently remains incurable and a need exists for new and better treatments.
Intended Results: Highlight delays in the reimbursement process, inquire about status of reimbursement of Pfizer's medicine for metatastic breast cancer, which was approved in the EU by the EMA in November 2016, through question to Minister for Health and build understanding that patients with metastatic breast cancer need new treatments. Pfizer's metastatic breast cancer medicine is the first new therapy in over 10 years for a specific subset of mBC patients.
